answers.answer: Your Mother may want to get bilateral mastectomies to remove as much breast tissue as possible. I'd discuss this with her and her TEAM. It may be the best choice considering her other medical issues. If her cancer is stage 1 they may consider forgoing chemo, radiation and arimidex therapies. Whatever choices made, I'd not leave the cancer in her body as it can and will metastasize.Invasive mammary carcinoma, also known as infiltrating mammary carcinoma, is a mixture of invasive ductal and lobular carcinomas; meaning the cancer grows at the junction of the duct and the lobule.

question: My mom was diagnosed this week with Infiltrating Mammary Carcinoma, Grade 1, Hormone +.  She is 77 years old, has Alzheimers Disease, high blood pressure and diabetes.  The suggested treatment is Arimidex and follow up mammograms.  My question is whether Infiltrating Mammary Carcinoma can metastasize, if so to what location and at what stage of the disease?Dr. D
title: Infiltrating Mammary Carcinoma Question
